alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 5:40AM AKST until January 22 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below occuring, with blowing snow with low visibility expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. North winds 15 mph will turn south and gust to 35 mph tonight and continue into Saturday. These winds will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow with visibility one half mile or less at times tonight and Saturday. * WHERE...In Brooks Range Passes * WHEN...Until noon Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds 15 mph will turn south and gust to 35 mph tonight and continue into Saturday. These winds will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow with visibility one half mile or less at times tonight and Saturday. Cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Large snow drifts will form. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
